title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
This position will be responsible for reporting to and collaborating closely with our Managing Architect. The chosen candidate will also have the opportunity to work closely with our President, who is a Civil Engineer as well. Acting as a small to medium design department within our organization, alongside internal architectural and civil design staff, the individual in this position will collaborate with our existing civil designers in the creation and drafting of various projects. These projects will range from zoning review and preliminary site layout to construction documents.
Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with the current civil designers to oversee the design and drafting of site layout, grading, storm and sanitary systems, and the review of drawings.
- Participate in the design and drafting of asphalt and concrete paving and slabs.
- Work with the current civil designers to acquire local zoning and EPA permits, as well as any necessary variances. Attend and provide support at occasional zoning meetings.
- Coordinate, supervise, and manage internal survey crews.
- Review and approve civil drawings for submission to appropriate jurisdictions.
- Collaborate with customers, zoning officials, external consultants, subcontractors, suppliers, and our internal staff of architectural and civil designers, sales, estimating, operations, and superintendents.
Requirements
Qualifications:
- BS in Civil Engineering
- Professional Engineer License, or the ability to obtain it within a year
- Minimum 3 years' experience in civil design or engineering work
- Proficient in Civil 3D/AutoCAD with knowledge of Revit (experience in Revit is preferred)
- Problem-solving skills with a good understanding of construction and surveying
- Willingness to meet with customers to understand their civil design needs
- Organized with excellent communication skills
- Ability to work under deadlines, detail-oriented and customer-focused
- Experience in concrete and structural steel design or engineering is a plus
Benefits
Our Client is an Equal Opportunity employer offering a full benefits package including Medical/Dental/Vision, 401k, Life Insurance, profit sharing, and bonuses.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Cisco Security Engineer
description:
Cisco Security Engineer
Job Number: 24-00409
Use your skills where innovative technology solutions begin. Eclaro is looking for a 
Cisco Security Engineer
 for our client in 
East Liberty, OH.
Eclaro’s client is a leading technology solutions provider, collaborating with customers to manage their needs and achieve success in their business goals. If you’re up to the challenge, then take a chance at this rewarding opportunity!
Position Overview:
- The primary objective of this position is to provide operational support to the client, providing onsite EST business day support and as required after normal business hours support. 
- Works closely with other groups and vendors to provide exceptional customer support. 
- As a Security Architect, will be the lead technical resource for Cisco technologies for the customer leading all security tasks related to Cisco Firepower architecture.
- As a Cisco Security Engineer, will be required to have experience and extensive knowledge of Cisco Firepower Firewalls and a clear understanding of Firewall and Local Area Networking around Cisco campus and data center networking components.
- The primary responsibilities will be to assist with installation, configuration, troubleshooting, support and sustainment of Cisco components.
Responsibilities:
- Troubleshoot Cisco Security Gateway Installations
- Implement, support and upgrade Cisco firewall appliances,
- Implement and support Cisco Firepower Technologies
- Develop, support and implement Firewall security policies
- Operate in a team environment as well as self-directed
- Collaborates with other team members as necessary to ensure customer service levels agreements (SLA's) are met
- Participate in on-call technical support rotation
- Understanding of LAN and WAN networking
- Understanding of Network Security
- Ensure firewall services and systems are always available and reliable.
- Respond to and manage service issues and problems.
- Report, pursue, communicate, and when needed escalate any breaches in information security or policies.
- Able to coordinate and work with on-site engineers during outage or critical situations.
- Adhere to established incident management SLA and SLOs.
- Able to document troubleshooting/process related documents for the team.
- Collaboration:
- Participation in working groups responsible for the deployment and development of global technology systems and infrastructure.
- Mentoring of staff on technical processes and procedures 
- Knowledge Sharing / Documentation:
- Contribute to, produce and maintain processes, procedures, operational and architectural documentation, that meet CTO Standards.
- Change Control - Ensure compliance with processes and adherence to standards and documentation.
- The responsibilities listed here represent a core set of duties for this position. 
- Responsibilities may be added or modified based upon business needs. Other duties may be assigned by managers of this role at their discretion.
Required Skills:
- Expert level understanding of Cisco Firepower
- Expert level of Cisco troubleshooting and debugging procedures
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls required
- High level understanding of Network Security architecture
- High level understanding of TCP/IP and networking
- Site-to-Site VPN & Client to Site VPN troubleshooting
Qualifications:
- B.S. in IT, MIS, CS, EE, Computer Engineering or equivalent related industry experience
- 5 years experience with TCP/IP protocol, switching and routing
- 5 years experience in a Firewall engineering and support position
- 3 years experience with Cisco Firepower Firewalls
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls
- Working experience performing Security Assessments a plus
- Multiple security certifications a plus
- Security+, CCNA and CCSE Certifications preferred
- Other Firewall knowledge a plus (Palo Alto)
If hired, you will enjoy the following Eclaro Benefits:
- 401k Retirement Savings Plan administered by Merrill Lynch
- Commuter Check Pretax Commuter Benefits
- Eligibility to purchase Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance through Eclaro
If interested, you may contact:
Tim Cusick 
Tim.cusick@eclaro.com
 
646-755-9317
Tim Cusick | LinkedIn
Equal Opportunity Employer:
 Eclaro values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Outside Sales Rep- Remote
description:
Alaant Workforce Solutions is proud to partner with a thriving branding company to hire an Outside Sales Representative! This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in a creative environment with prior design and build experience. 
Hours and Benefits for the Outside Sales Representative: 
- Flexible work schedule working remotely
- Roughly 30%-50% travel required 
- Base salary plus lucrative bonus potential
- Competitive benefits including an IRA with a match, paid holidays and PTO
Responsibilities for the Outside Sales Representative:
- Achieve established sales objectives within the assigned territory which includes OH, MI, KY, WV, Western PA and Western NY
- Develop and maintain a robust customer base, servicing as the primary liaison between clients, and the company’s design concepts
- Secure profitable sales growth by meeting annual plans and goals set by management 
- Present project specifications and customer needs for a proposal development and project completion
- Deliver effective presentations showcasing the features, benefits, and advantages of the company’s services 
- Attend trade shows and conferences to promote the company’s design concepts
- Complete all periodic and special reports as required
- Utilize CRM system for client management and internal communication
Requirements for the Outside Sales Representative:
- Associates degree in business administration or related 
- At least 4 years of outside sales experience
- Must have a background in design concepts, architecture, or graphics 
- Proficient in CRM systems and MS Office 
For more details on this role contact:

title: Cisco Security Engineer
description:
Cisco Security Engineer
Job Number: 24-00409
Use your skills where innovative technology solutions begin. Eclaro is looking for a 
Cisco Security Engineer
 for our client in 
East Liberty, OH.
Eclaro’s client is a leading technology solutions provider, collaborating with customers to manage their needs and achieve success in their business goals. If you’re up to the challenge, then take a chance at this rewarding opportunity!
Position Overview:
- The primary objective of this position is to provide operational support to the client, providing onsite EST business day support and as required after normal business hours support. 
- Works closely with other groups and vendors to provide exceptional customer support. 
- As a Security Architect, will be the lead technical resource for Cisco technologies for the customer leading all security tasks related to Cisco Firepower architecture.
- As a Cisco Security Engineer, will be required to have experience and extensive knowledge of Cisco Firepower Firewalls and a clear understanding of Firewall and Local Area Networking around Cisco campus and data center networking components.
- The primary responsibilities will be to assist with installation, configuration, troubleshooting, support and sustainment of Cisco components.
Responsibilities:
- Troubleshoot Cisco Security Gateway Installations
- Implement, support and upgrade Cisco firewall appliances,
- Implement and support Cisco Firepower Technologies
- Develop, support and implement Firewall security policies
- Operate in a team environment as well as self-directed
- Collaborates with other team members as necessary to ensure customer service levels agreements (SLA's) are met
- Participate in on-call technical support rotation
- Understanding of LAN and WAN networking
- Understanding of Network Security
- Ensure firewall services and systems are always available and reliable.
- Respond to and manage service issues and problems.
- Report, pursue, communicate, and when needed escalate any breaches in information security or policies.
- Able to coordinate and work with on-site engineers during outage or critical situations.
- Adhere to established incident management SLA and SLOs.
- Able to document troubleshooting/process related documents for the team.
- Collaboration:
- Participation in working groups responsible for the deployment and development of global technology systems and infrastructure.
- Mentoring of staff on technical processes and procedures 
- Knowledge Sharing / Documentation:
- Contribute to, produce and maintain processes, procedures, operational and architectural documentation, that meet CTO Standards.
- Change Control - Ensure compliance with processes and adherence to standards and documentation.
- The responsibilities listed here represent a core set of duties for this position. 
- Responsibilities may be added or modified based upon business needs. Other duties may be assigned by managers of this role at their discretion.
Required Skills:
- Expert level understanding of Cisco Firepower
- Expert level of Cisco troubleshooting and debugging procedures
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls required
- High level understanding of Network Security architecture
- High level understanding of TCP/IP and networking
- Site-to-Site VPN & Client to Site VPN troubleshooting
Qualifications:
- B.S. in IT, MIS, CS, EE, Computer Engineering or equivalent related industry experience
- 5 years experience with TCP/IP protocol, switching and routing
- 5 years experience in a Firewall engineering and support position
- 3 years experience with Cisco Firepower Firewalls
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls
- Working experience performing Security Assessments a plus
- Multiple security certifications a plus
- Security+, CCNA and CCSE Certifications preferred
- Other Firewall knowledge a plus (Palo Alto)
If hired, you will enjoy the following Eclaro Benefits:
- 401k Retirement Savings Plan administered by Merrill Lynch
- Commuter Check Pretax Commuter Benefits
- Eligibility to purchase Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance through Eclaro
If interested, you may contact:
Tim Cusick 
Tim.cusick@eclaro.com
 
646-755-9317
Tim Cusick | LinkedIn
Equal Opportunity Employer:
 Eclaro values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Outside Sales Rep- Remote
description:
Alaant Workforce Solutions is proud to partner with a thriving branding company to hire an Outside Sales Representative! This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives in a creative environment with prior design and build experience. 
Hours and Benefits for the Outside Sales Representative: 
- Flexible work schedule working remotely
- Roughly 30%-50% travel required 
- Base salary plus lucrative bonus potential
- Competitive benefits including an IRA with a match, paid holidays and PTO
Responsibilities for the Outside Sales Representative:
- Achieve established sales objectives within the assigned territory which includes OH, MI, KY, WV, Western PA and Western NY
- Develop and maintain a robust customer base, servicing as the primary liaison between clients, and the company’s design concepts
- Secure profitable sales growth by meeting annual plans and goals set by management 
- Present project specifications and customer needs for a proposal development and project completion
- Deliver effective presentations showcasing the features, benefits, and advantages of the company’s services 
- Attend trade shows and conferences to promote the company’s design concepts
- Complete all periodic and special reports as required
- Utilize CRM system for client management and internal communication
Requirements for the Outside Sales Representative:
- Associates degree in business administration or related 
- At least 4 years of outside sales experience
- Must have a background in design concepts, architecture, or graphics 
- Proficient in CRM systems and MS Office 
For more details on this role contact:
Ila Kochan, She/Her/Hers, Talent Acquisition Specialist, 
Ila.kochan@alaant.com
, (518)-689-0716
Alaant Workforce Solutions wants all interested applicants to know we hire a diverse workforce and are actively recruiting candidates in accordance with diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity policies. 
This is an immediate opportunity. The interview process will be comprised of a combination of virtual and onsite meetings/interviews. 
Connect with us on

,

,

,

At Alaant we believe in People First! We Care. We Listen & We Support.

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
This position will be responsible for reporting to and collaborating closely with our Managing Architect. The chosen candidate will also have the opportunity to work closely with our President, who is a Civil Engineer as well. Acting as a small to medium design department within our organization, alongside internal architectural and civil design staff, the individual in this position will collaborate with our existing civil designers in the creation and drafting of various projects. These projects will range from zoning review and preliminary site layout to construction documents.
Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with the current civil designers to oversee the design and drafting of site layout, grading, storm and sanitary systems, and the review of drawings.
- Participate in the design and drafting of asphalt and concrete paving and slabs.
- Work with the current civil designers to acquire local zoning and EPA permits, as well as any necessary variances. Attend and provide support at occasional zoning meetings.
- Coordinate, supervise, and manage internal survey crews.
- Review and approve civil drawings for submission to appropriate jurisdictions.
- Collaborate with customers, zoning officials, external consultants, subcontractors, suppliers, and our internal staff of architectural and civil designers, sales, estimating, operations, and superintendents.
Requirements
Qualifications:
- BS in Civil Engineering
- Professional Engineer License, or the ability to obtain it within a year
- Minimum 3 years' experience in civil design or engineering work
- Proficient in Civil 3D/AutoCAD with knowledge of Revit (experience in Revit is preferred)
- Problem-solving skills with a good understanding of construction and surveying
- Willingness to meet with customers to understand their civil design needs
- Organized with excellent communication skills
- Ability to work under deadlines, detail-oriented and customer-focused
- Experience in concrete and structural steel design or engineering is a plus
Benefits
Our Client is an Equal Opportunity employer offering a full benefits package including Medical/Dental/Vision, 401k, Life Insurance, profit sharing, and bonuses.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
This position will be responsible for reporting to and collaborating closely with our Managing Architect. The chosen candidate will also have the opportunity to work closely with our President, who is a Civil Engineer as well. Acting as a small to medium design department within our organization, alongside internal architectural and civil design staff, the individual in this position will collaborate with our existing civil designers in the creation and drafting of various projects. These projects will range from zoning review and preliminary site layout to construction documents.
Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with the current civil designers to oversee the design and drafting of site layout, grading, storm and sanitary systems, and the review of drawings.
- Participate in the design and drafting of asphalt and concrete paving and slabs.
- Work with the current civil designers to acquire local zoning and EPA permits, as well as any necessary variances. Attend and provide support at occasional zoning meetings.
- Coordinate, supervise, and manage internal survey crews.
- Review and approve civil drawings for submission to appropriate jurisdictions.
- Collaborate with customers, zoning officials, external consultants, subcontractors, suppliers, and our internal staff of architectural and civil designers, sales, estimating, operations, and superintendents.
Requirements
Qualifications:
- BS in Civil Engineering
- Professional Engineer License, or the ability to obtain it within a year
- Minimum 3 years' experience in civil design or engineering work
- Proficient in Civil 3D/AutoCAD with knowledge of Revit (experience in Revit is preferred)
- Problem-solving skills with a good understanding of construction and surveying
- Willingness to meet with customers to understand their civil design needs
- Organized with excellent communication skills
- Ability to work under deadlines, detail-oriented and customer-focused
- Experience in concrete and structural steel design or engineering is a plus
Benefits
Our Client is an Equal Opportunity employer offering a full benefits package including Medical/Dental/Vision, 401k, Life Insurance, profit sharing, and bonuses.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Cisco Security Engineer
description:
Cisco Security Engineer
Job Number: 24-00409
Use your skills where innovative technology solutions begin. Eclaro is looking for a 
Cisco Security Engineer
 for our client in 
East Liberty, OH.
Eclaro’s client is a leading technology solutions provider, collaborating with customers to manage their needs and achieve success in their business goals. If you’re up to the challenge, then take a chance at this rewarding opportunity!
Position Overview:
- The primary objective of this position is to provide operational support to the client, providing onsite EST business day support and as required after normal business hours support. 
- Works closely with other groups and vendors to provide exceptional customer support. 
- As a Security Architect, will be the lead technical resource for Cisco technologies for the customer leading all security tasks related to Cisco Firepower architecture.
- As a Cisco Security Engineer, will be required to have experience and extensive knowledge of Cisco Firepower Firewalls and a clear understanding of Firewall and Local Area Networking around Cisco campus and data center networking components.
- The primary responsibilities will be to assist with installation, configuration, troubleshooting, support and sustainment of Cisco components.
Responsibilities:
- Troubleshoot Cisco Security Gateway Installations
- Implement, support and upgrade Cisco firewall appliances,
- Implement and support Cisco Firepower Technologies
- Develop, support and implement Firewall security policies
- Operate in a team environment as well as self-directed
- Collaborates with other team members as necessary to ensure customer service levels agreements (SLA's) are met
- Participate in on-call technical support rotation
- Understanding of LAN and WAN networking
- Understanding of Network Security
- Ensure firewall services and systems are always available and reliable.
- Respond to and manage service issues and problems.
- Report, pursue, communicate, and when needed escalate any breaches in information security or policies.
- Able to coordinate and work with on-site engineers during outage or critical situations.
- Adhere to established incident management SLA and SLOs.
- Able to document troubleshooting/process related documents for the team.
- Collaboration:
- Participation in working groups responsible for the deployment and development of global technology systems and infrastructure.
- Mentoring of staff on technical processes and procedures 
- Knowledge Sharing / Documentation:
- Contribute to, produce and maintain processes, procedures, operational and architectural documentation, that meet CTO Standards.
- Change Control - Ensure compliance with processes and adherence to standards and documentation.
- The responsibilities listed here represent a core set of duties for this position. 
- Responsibilities may be added or modified based upon business needs. Other duties may be assigned by managers of this role at their discretion.
Required Skills:
- Expert level understanding of Cisco Firepower
- Expert level of Cisco troubleshooting and debugging procedures
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls required
- High level understanding of Network Security architecture
- High level understanding of TCP/IP and networking
- Site-to-Site VPN & Client to Site VPN troubleshooting
Qualifications:
- B.S. in IT, MIS, CS, EE, Computer Engineering or equivalent related industry experience
- 5 years experience with TCP/IP protocol, switching and routing
- 5 years experience in a Firewall engineering and support position
- 3 years experience with Cisco Firepower Firewalls
- Experience working with Palo Alto Firewalls
- Working experience performing Security Assessments a plus
- Multiple security certifications a plus
- Security+, CCNA and CCSE Certifications preferred
- Other Firewall knowledge a plus (Palo Alto)
If hired, you will enjoy the following Eclaro Benefits:
- 401k Retirement Savings Plan administered by Merrill Lynch
- Commuter Check Pretax Commuter Benefits
- Eligibility to purchase Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance through Eclaro
If interested, you may contact:
Tim Cusick 
Tim.cusick@eclaro.com
 
646-755-9317
Tim Cusick | LinkedIn
Equal Opportunity Employer:
 Eclaro values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.
